channel.title: CVE Feed for wpwhitesecurity -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpwhitesecurity -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-36716|2024-08-04T17:37:07.326Z -- wpwhitesecurity -- wp%20activity%20log
item.description: The WP Activity Log plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to authorization bypass due to a missing capability check on the setup_page function in versions up to, and including, 4.0.1. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to run the setup wizard (if it has not been run previously) and access plugin configuration options.

item.title: CVE-2024-2018|2024-06-06T13:35:45.997Z -- wpwhitesecurity -- wp%20activity%20log%20premium
item.description: The WP Activity Log Premium plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the entry->roles parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.6.4 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber privileges to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database. One demonstrated attack included the injection of a PHP Object.

item.title: CVE-2024-2018|2024-08-01T18:56:22.532Z -- wpwhitesecurity -- wp%20activity%20log%20premium
item.description: The WP Activity Log Premium plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the entry->roles parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.6.4 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with subscriber privileges to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database. One demonstrated attack included the injection of a PHP Object.
